verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron:

verses.kjv: Take the sum of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, after their families, by the house of their fathers,
verses.web: “Take a census of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, by their families, by their fathers’ houses,
verses.ct: "Take a census of the Kohathite clan within the tribe of Levi, organized by their families and ancestral households.

verses.kjv: From thirty years old and upward even until fifty years old, all that enter into the host, to do the work in the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.web: from thirty years old and upward even until fifty years old, all who enter into the service to do the work in the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: Count every man between 30 and 50 years old who is eligible to serve and do the work in the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: This shall be the service of the sons of Kohath in the tabernacle of the congregation, about the most holy things:
verses.web: “This is the service of the sons of Kohath in the Tent of Meeting, regarding the most holy things.
verses.ct: The Kohathites' responsibility in the Tent of Meeting involves the most holy objects.

verses.kjv: And when the camp setteth forward, Aaron shall come, and his sons, and they shall take down the covering vail, and cover the ark of testimony with it:
verses.web: When the camp moves forward, Aaron shall go in with his sons; and they shall take down the veil of the screen, cover the ark of the Testimony with it,
verses.ct: When the camp is ready to move, Aaron and his sons must go in first and take down the inner curtain, then use it to cover the ark of the testimony.

verses.kjv: And shall put thereon the covering of badgers’ skins, and shall spread over it a cloth wholly of blue, and shall put in the staves thereof.
verses.web: put a covering of sealskin on it, spread a blue cloth over it, and put in its poles.
verses.ct: Over that, they must place a covering of sealskin, then spread a solid blue cloth on top, and insert the carrying poles.

verses.kjv: And upon the table of shewbread they shall spread a cloth of blue, and put thereon the dishes, and the spoons, and the bowls, and covers to cover withal: and the continual bread shall be thereon:
verses.web: “On the table of show bread they shall spread a blue cloth, and put on it the dishes, the spoons, the bowls, and the cups with which to pour out; and the continual bread shall be on it.
verses.ct: Over the table of showbread, they must spread a blue cloth and place on it the dishes, spoons, bowls, and pitchers. The bread that is always kept there must remain on it.

verses.kjv: And they shall spread upon them a cloth of scarlet, and cover the same with a covering of badgers’ skins, and shall put in the staves thereof.
verses.web: They shall spread on them a scarlet cloth, and cover it with a covering of sealskin, and shall put in its poles.
verses.ct: Then they must spread a scarlet cloth over everything, cover it with a sealskin covering, and insert the carrying poles.

verses.kjv: And they shall take a cloth of blue, and cover the candlestick of the light, and his lamps, and his tongs, and his snuffdishes, and all the oil vessels thereof, wherewith they minister unto it:
verses.web: “They shall take a blue cloth and cover the lamp stand of the light, its lamps, its snuffers, its snuff dishes, and all its oil vessels, with which they minister to it.
verses.ct: They must take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand along with its lamps, wick trimmers, trays, and all the oil containers used to tend it.

verses.kjv: And they shall put it and all the vessels thereof within a covering of badgers’ skins, and shall put it upon a bar.
verses.web: They shall put it and all its vessels within a covering of sealskin, and shall put it on the frame.
verses.ct: Then they must wrap the lampstand and all its equipment in a sealskin covering and place it on a carrying frame.

verses.kjv: And upon the golden altar they shall spread a cloth of blue, and cover it with a covering of badgers’ skins, and shall put to the staves thereof:
verses.web: “On the golden altar they shall spread a blue cloth, and cover it with a covering of sealskin, and shall put in its poles.
verses.ct: Over the golden altar, they must spread a blue cloth, cover it with a sealskin covering, and insert its carrying poles.

verses.kjv: And they shall take all the instruments of ministry, wherewith they minister in the sanctuary, and put them in a cloth of blue, and cover them with a covering of badgers’ skins, and shall put them on a bar:
verses.web: “They shall take all the vessels of ministry with which they minister in the sanctuary, and put them in a blue cloth, cover them with a covering of sealskin, and shall put them on the frame.
verses.ct: They must gather all the utensils used for service in the sanctuary, wrap them in a blue cloth, cover them with a sealskin covering, and place them on a carrying frame.

verses.kjv: And they shall take away the ashes from the altar, and spread a purple cloth thereon:
verses.web: “They shall take away the ashes from the altar, and spread a purple cloth on it.
verses.ct: They must remove the ashes from the bronze altar and spread a purple cloth over it.

verses.kjv: And they shall put upon it all the vessels thereof, wherewith they minister about it, even the censers, the fleshhooks, and the shovels, and the basons, all the vessels of the altar; and they shall spread upon it a covering of badgers’ skins, and put to the staves of it.
verses.web: They shall put on it all its vessels with which they minister about it, the fire pans, the meat hooks, the shovels, and the basins—all the vessels of the altar; and they shall spread on it a covering of sealskin, and put in its poles.
verses.ct: On top of that, they must place all the altar's equipment — the firepans, meat hooks, shovels, and basins — everything used at the altar. Then they must spread a sealskin covering over it all and insert the carrying poles.

verses.kjv: And when Aaron and his sons have made an end of covering the sanctuary, and all the vessels of the sanctuary, as the camp is to set forward; after that, the sons of Kohath shall come to bear it: but they shall not touch any holy thing, lest they die. These things are the burden of the sons of Kohath in the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.web: “When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the furniture of the sanctuary, as the camp moves forward; after that, the sons of Kohath shall come to carry it; but they shall not touch the sanctuary, lest they die. The sons of Kohath shall carry these things belonging to the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: Once Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all its furnishings and the camp is ready to move out, the Kohathites may come to carry these things. But they must not touch any of the holy objects, or they will die. These are the items the Kohathites are responsible to carry from the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And to the office of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest pertaineth the oil for the light, and the sweet incense, and the daily meat offering, and the anointing oil, and the oversight of all the tabernacle, and of all that therein is, in the sanctuary, and in the vessels thereof.
verses.web: “The duty of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest shall be the oil for the light, the sweet incense, the continual meal offering, and the anointing oil, the requirements of all the tabernacle, and of all that is in it, the sanctuary, and its furnishings.”
verses.ct: Eleazar son of Aaron the priest is personally responsible for the oil for the lampstand, the fragrant incense, the daily grain offering, and the anointing oil. He also has oversight of the entire tabernacle and everything in it — the sanctuary and all its furnishings."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron:

verses.kjv: Cut ye not off the tribe of the families of the Kohathites from among the Levites:
verses.web: “Don’t cut off the tribe of the families of the Kohathites from among the Levites;
verses.ct: "Don't let the Kohathite clans be destroyed from among the Levites.

verses.kjv: But thus do unto them, that they may live, and not die, when they approach unto the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in, and appoint them every one to his service and to his burden:
verses.web: but thus do to them, that they may live, and not die, when they approach the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in and appoint everyone to his service and to his burden;
verses.ct: Here's what you must do so they can live and not die when they come near the most holy objects: Aaron and his sons must go in first and assign each man his specific task and what he is to carry.

verses.kjv: But they shall not go in to see when the holy things are covered, lest they die.
verses.web: but they shall not go in to see the sanctuary even for a moment, lest they die.”
verses.ct: The Kohathites must never go in to look at the holy objects, even for a moment, or they will die."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses:

verses.kjv: Take also the sum of the sons of Gershon, throughout the houses of their fathers, by their families;
verses.web: “Take a census of the sons of Gershon also, by their fathers’ houses, by their families;
verses.ct: "Take a census of the Gershonites as well, organized by their ancestral households and families.

verses.kjv: From thirty years old and upward until fifty years old shalt thou number them; all that enter in to perform the service, to do the work in the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.web: you shall count them from thirty years old and upward until fifty years old: all who enter in to wait on the service, to do the work in the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: Count every man between 30 and 50 years old who is eligible to serve and do the work in the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, to serve, and for burdens:
verses.web: “This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, in serving and in bearing burdens:
verses.ct: Here is what the Gershonite families are responsible to do and carry:

verses.kjv: And they shall bear the curtains of the tabernacle, and the tabernacle of the congregation, his covering, and the covering of the badgers’ skins that is above upon it, and the hanging for the door of the tabernacle of the congregation,
verses.web: they shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle and the Tent of Meeting, its covering, the covering of sealskin that is on it, the screen for the door of the Tent of Meeting,
verses.ct: They must carry the curtains of the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting with its covering, the sealskin covering that goes over it, and the screen for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And the hangings of the court, and the hanging for the door of the gate of the court, which is by the tabernacle and by the altar round about, and their cords, and all the instruments of their service, and all that is made for them: so shall they serve.
verses.web: the hangings of the court, the screen for the door of the gate of the court which is by the tabernacle and around the altar, their cords, and all the instruments of their service, and whatever shall be done with them. They shall serve in there.
verses.ct: They must also carry the courtyard hangings, the screen for the entrance to the courtyard gate surrounding the tabernacle and altar, all the ropes, and every piece of equipment needed for their work. They are responsible for all the service connected to these items.

verses.kjv: At the appointment of Aaron and his sons shall be all the service of the sons of the Gershonites, in all their burdens, and in all their service: and ye shall appoint unto them in charge all their burdens.
verses.web: At the commandment of Aaron and his sons shall be all the service of the sons of the Gershonites, in all their burden and in all their service; and you shall appoint their duty to them in all their responsibilities.
verses.ct: Everything the Gershonites do — every load they carry and every task they perform — must be directed by Aaron and his sons. You must assign them specific responsibility for everything they are to carry.

verses.kjv: This is the service of the families of the sons of Gershon in the tabernacle of the congregation: and their charge shall be under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.web: This is the service of the families of the sons of the Gershonites in the Tent of Meeting. Their duty shall be under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.ct: This is the work assigned to the Gershonite families at the Tent of Meeting. Their duties fall under the supervision of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.

verses.kjv: As for the sons of Merari, thou shalt number them after their families, by the house of their fathers;
verses.web: “As for the sons of Merari, you shall count them by their families, by their fathers’ houses;
verses.ct: Now count the Merarites, organized by their families and ancestral households.

verses.kjv: From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old shalt thou number them, every one that entereth into the service, to do the work of the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.web: you shall count them from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old—everyone who enters on the service, to do the work of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: Count every man between 30 and 50 years old who is eligible to serve and do the work of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And this is the charge of their burden, according to all their service in the tabernacle of the congregation; the boards of the tabernacle, and the bars thereof, and the pillars thereof, and sockets thereof,
verses.web: This is the duty of their burden, according to all their service in the Tent of Meeting: the tabernacle’s boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets,
verses.ct: Here is what they are responsible to carry as part of their service at the Tent of Meeting: the frames of the tabernacle, its crossbars, posts, and bases,

verses.kjv: And the pillars of the court round about, and their sockets, and their pins, and their cords, with all their instruments, and with all their service: and by name ye shall reckon the instruments of the charge of their burden.
verses.web: the pillars of the court around it, their sockets, their pins, their cords, with all their instruments, and with all their service. You shall appoint the instruments of the duty of their burden to them by name.
verses.ct: the posts around the courtyard with their bases, tent pegs, and ropes, along with all the related equipment and everything needed for their work. Assign each man by name the specific items he is responsible to carry.

verses.kjv: This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, according to all their service, in the tabernacle of the congregation, under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.web: This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, according to all their service in the Tent of Meeting, under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.”
verses.ct: This is the work assigned to the Merarite families — all their duties at the Tent of Meeting, under the supervision of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest."

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron and the chief of the congregation numbered the sons of the Kohathites after their families, and after the house of their fathers,
verses.web: Moses and Aaron and the princes of the congregation counted the sons of the Kohathites by their families, and by their fathers’ houses,
verses.ct: Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of the community counted the Kohathites by their families and ancestral households.

verses.kjv: From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old, every one that entereth into the service, for the work in the tabernacle of the congregation:
verses.web: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service for work in the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: They counted every man between 30 and 50 years old who was eligible to serve and work at the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And those that were numbered of them by their families were two thousand seven hundred and fifty.
verses.web: Those who were counted of them by their families were two thousand seven hundred fifty.
verses.ct: The total for the Kohathite families was 2,750.

verses.kjv: These were they that were numbered of the families of the Kohathites, all that might do service in the tabernacle of the congregation, which Moses and Aaron did number according to the commandment of the LORD by the hand of Moses.
verses.web: These are those who were counted of the families of the Kohathites, all who served in the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the commandment of LORD by Moses.
verses.ct: This was the count of the Kohathite families — everyone who served at the Tent of Meeting. Moses and Aaron counted them just as the LORD had commanded through Moses.

verses.kjv: And those that were numbered of the sons of Gershon, throughout their families, and by the house of their fathers,
verses.web: Those who were counted of the sons of Gershon, by their families, and by their fathers’ houses,
verses.ct: The Gershonites were also counted by their families and ancestral households.

verses.kjv: From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old, every one that entereth into the service, for the work in the tabernacle of the congregation,
verses.web: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old—everyone who entered into the service for work in the Tent of Meeting,
verses.ct: Every man between 30 and 50 years old who was eligible to serve and work at the Tent of Meeting was counted.

verses.kjv: Even those that were numbered of them, throughout their families, by the house of their fathers, were two thousand and six hundred and thirty.
verses.web: even those who were counted of them, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, were two thousand six hundred thirty.
verses.ct: The total for the Gershonite families was 2,630.

verses.kjv: These are they that were numbered of the families of the sons of Gershon, of all that might do service in the tabernacle of the congregation, whom Moses and Aaron did number according to the commandment of the LORD.
verses.web: These are those who were counted of the families of the sons of Gershon, all who served in the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the commandment of LORD.
verses.ct: This was the count of the Gershonite families — everyone who served at the Tent of Meeting. Moses and Aaron counted them just as the LORD had commanded.

verses.kjv: And those that were numbered of the families of the sons of Merari, throughout their families, by the house of their fathers,
verses.web: Those who were counted of the families of the sons of Merari, by their families, by their fathers’ houses,
verses.ct: The Merarites were counted by their families and ancestral households.

verses.kjv: From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old, every one that entereth into the service, for the work in the tabernacle of the congregation,
verses.web: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old—everyone who entered into the service for work in the Tent of Meeting,
verses.ct: Every man between 30 and 50 years old who was eligible to serve and work at the Tent of Meeting was counted.

verses.kjv: Even those that were numbered of them after their families, were three thousand and two hundred.
verses.web: even those who were counted of them by their families, were three thousand two hundred.
verses.ct: The total for the Merarite families was 3,200.

verses.kjv: These be those that were numbered of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the word of the LORD by the hand of Moses.
verses.web: These are those who were counted of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the commandment of LORD by Moses.
verses.ct: This was the count of the Merarite families. Moses and Aaron counted them just as the LORD had commanded through Moses.

verses.kjv: All those that were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron and the chief of Israel numbered, after their families, and after the house of their fathers,
verses.web: All those who were counted of the Levites whom Moses and Aaron and the princes of Israel counted, by their families and by their fathers’ houses,
verses.ct: So Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of Israel completed the census of all the Levites, organized by their families and ancestral households.

verses.kjv: From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old, every one that came to do the service of the ministry, and the service of the burden in the tabernacle of the congregation,
verses.web: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered in to do the work of service and the work of bearing burdens in the Tent of Meeting,
verses.ct: Every man between 30 and 50 years old who was eligible to serve — whether in ministry duties or carrying loads at the Tent of Meeting —

verses.kjv: Even those that were numbered of them, were eight thousand and five hundred and fourscore.
verses.web: even those who were counted of them, were eight thousand five hundred eighty.
verses.ct: came to a grand total of 8,580.

verses.kjv: According to the commandment of the LORD they were numbered by the hand of Moses, every one according to his service, and according to his burden: thus were they numbered of him, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: According to the commandment of LORD they were counted by Moses, everyone according to his service and according to his burden. Thus they were counted by him, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Each man was counted and assigned his specific task and load, just as the LORD had commanded Moses. This is how the census was completed, exactly as the LORD had ordered.
